P000035.project_name: Lobito Benguela Urban Environmental Rehabilitation Project

keywords.cdata: abundance of water,administrative bodies,administrative support,Agricultural production,aquatic ecosystems,aquifer,bacteria,basic sanitation,basins,Capacity Building,central government,Child mortality,chlorination,clean water,collection systems,community leaders,Community Services,Competitive Bidding,copper,Cost Recovery,cost recovery objectives,cubic meter,cubic meters,demand for water,dirty water,disinfection,Drainage,Environmental Assessments,Environmental degradation,environmental hazards,environmental impacts,environmental issues,Environmental Management,Environmental Sanitation,erosion control,fresh water,garbage,groundwater,groundwater pollution,industrial users,inlets,iron,latrines,laundry,leaks,liters per capita per day,local service providers,low cost sanitation technology,manganese,municipal authorities,municipal water,municipal water supply,municipalities,oxidation,oxidation ponds,pathogens,plumbing,pollution,pond,project management,Provincial Government,Provincial Water,Provision of water,public health,public utilities,public utility,pumping,pumping equipment,pumping station,Pumping stations,pumps,raw sewage,reservoirs,River basin,sanitary sewer systems,sanitary sewerage,Sanitary Sewers,sanitation component,sanitation programs,septic tanks,sewage network,sewer networks,sewer pipes,sewerage,sewerage systems,sludge,small communities,soil erosion,Solid Waste,Solid Waste Collection,Solid Waste Management,spare parts,standpipes,storage capacity,Storm Drainage,surface

project_abstract.cdata: The project consists of the following components : (a) environmental sanitation which comprises the rehabilitation and expansion of the water supply distribution and sanitary sewer systems; the rehabilitation of the solid waste management system; and the rehabilitation of the storm drainage and erosion control network; (b) low income sanitation which provides clean urban water to all unplanned settlements via a network of 500 standpipes and laundry facilities; a massive improved latrine and sanitary environmental education program; and a modest urban revegetation program; (c) institutional development which consists of technical assistance and training, and logistical and administrative support for the Provincial Water Company; for the Provincial Community Services Department; and for the Provincial Planning Office to manage and monitor the project as a whole; and lastly, (d) studies which assist the Government to reorganize the Provincial Water Company; set economic water and sewer tariffs; define policy issues and action plans for environmental management.
